image.altText: Two police officers talk to each other on the side of a road

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old boy who died in a "tragic situation" after being struck by a car on the Tasman Highway near midnight was lying on the road, police believe.

title.children: Boy 'lying on the road' struck and killed in Tasmanian highway crash, police say

image.altText: Wappa Dam overflowing with water.

props.synopsis: The threat of heavy rainfall is moving north to Brisbane and the Sunshine Coast, but the severe weather warning has been cancelled this afternoon.

title.children: ADF deployed to Queensland as threat of rainfall and flash flooding moves north

image.altText: A Korean man in suitgrabs another man in the middle of a tightly packed crowd.

props.synopsis: The opposition leader was transported to a nearby hospital in a helicopter.

title.children: South Korean opposition leader stabbed in the neck during press conference

image.altText: A Facebook photo of former professional cyclist Melissa Hoskins.

props.synopsis: The family of Melissa Hoskins say they are "utterly devastated" following the death of the Olympic cyclist over the weekend.

title.children: 'Her children have lost their mum': Family of Olympic cyclist Melissa Hoskins speaks out

image.altText: A woman smiles with a medal.

props.synopsis: The death of world champion cyclist Melissa Hoskins and the arrest of her husband Rohan Dennis, who has been charged with dangerous driving offences, send shock waves through Australian sporting circles and the broader cycling world.

title.children: Melissa Hoskins's death has left the cycling world grief-stricken — here's what we know so far

image.altText: A damaged helicopter on a sandbank.

props.synopsis: An ATSB interim report reveals traces of cocaine found in Sea World pilot's system after the crash, and that it has issued an industry-wide safety notice about seatbelts on passengers not being fitted correctly on a regular basis.

title.children: Tests find traces of cocaine in pilot killed in Sea World helicopter crash

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A composite image showing a woman walking, a firefighter, a female soccer player and King Charles.

props.synopsis: Editors have picked the most significant photos from across the world in 2023. Take a look back at the year in news.

title.children: The biggest headlines of 2023 captured by photographers across the world

image.altText: Five people in royal attire pose for a portrait, Queen Margrethe and Prince Frederik are seated at front adorned in jewels

props.synopsis: From a feud over her grandchildren's titles, to a Spanish tabloid's claims of infidelity, the last few years have been dramatic for the Danish monarchy.

title.children: The tumultuous year of family drama and cheating rumours that preceded Queen Margrethe's abdication

image.altText: Smoke rising from a burning factory fire.

props.synopsis: Fire authorities have contained a factory fire on Plummer Road in Laverton North.

title.children: Factory fire sends smoke billowing over Melbourne's west

image.altText: A front-on close-up of a crocodile laying on a muddy river bank.

props.synopsis: The Queensland government is investigating after a Mackay fisher said a crocodile that had been "watching" him launched into his boat on Sunday night.

title.children: Man says 4-metre croc jumped into his tinnie 'jaws wide open' after watching him on New Year's Eve

image.altText: A Facebook profile photo of a man in a singlet.

props.synopsis: The 75-year-old Queensland man charged over Sunday's outback rail crash at a crossing on the Barrier Highway that killed two freight train drivers is granted bail, on the condition that he report daily to police.

title.children: Truckie granted bail after horror crash that killed freight train drivers near SA-NSW border

image.altText: A woman dressed in very bright colourful clothes as a clown, with her hands on her head, making a child smile.

props.synopsis: Marcelle Kersenboom almost didn't survive childhood, but she used its toughest times to create a career she loves.

title.children: Marcelle struggled in and out of hospitals but found success after being told to 'go home and become a clown'

image.altText: David Warner looks to one side surrounded by his teammates

props.synopsis: David Warner has called for the return of his baggy green cap after it went missing ahead of his final Test appearance for Australia.

title.children: 'It's sentimental to me': David Warner makes public plea for return of missing baggy green cap ahead of final Test

image.altText: Insulin testing equipment with a needle to the right and a small electronic device for testing levels left

props.synopsis: Researchers at the Baker Heart and Diabetes Institute say they've discovered a way to make pancreatic cells produce insulin using existing cancer drugs.

title.children: Researchers say diabetes treatment breakthrough could lead to end of insulin injections

image.altText: A large blue fish

props.synopsis: Locals were upset after they spotted a man in a wetsuit and snorkel, carrying a speargun and hauling the endangered fish across the rock platform at  Cronulla.

title.children: Outrage over fine for spearing of blue groper at Sydney beach

image.altText: A man with shoulder-length blonde hair looking into the camera as he speaks

props.synopsis: Lachlan Galbraith posts a video apology after CCTV footage of him shoplifting was made public by a New Zealand store.

title.children: Ocean Alley band member makes public apology after being caught shoplifting on CCTV

image.altText: A populated beach with blue waters and large rock at its centre

props.synopsis: Police say two friends, who had been travelling across the state, were sleeping in a vehicle parked at Twilight Beach when another person opened their car door during the night.

title.children: Woman sleeping in car allegedly sexually assaulted at popular WA beach

image.altText: A view from above showing houses that have been damaged after an earthquake.

props.synopsis: A series of powerful earthquakes struck central Japan on Monday, killing at least 48 people, officials say, destroying buildings, knocking out power to tens of thousands of homes, and prompting residents in some areas to flee.

title.children: Japan earthquake death toll rises to 48 with rescuers in 'battle against time' to find survivors

image.altText: Composite image of two smiling young blonde boys, one holding a butterfly (left) and one headshot with head tilted up

props.synopsis: The families of two young boys who died when they were thrown from an off-road vehicle into a waterhole during a Christmas holiday in New Zealand say their hearts are "unmendable".

title.children: WA boy and cousin die after being thrown from vehicle into waterhole on New Zealand farm

image.altText: Car drives through floodwater

props.synopsis: The SES warns motorists about flooding dangers after extraordinary footage emerges of a car towing a trailer through floodwater in NSW before a bridge is swept away by raging torrent.

title.children: Driver towing trailer through flooded river 'seconds' from disaster as bridge gives way in 530mm NSW deluge

image.altText: White banner saying "another sold" following house sale

props.synopsis: Sydney remains the most expensive city in the country to buy a property with the average home in Greater Sydney now worth almost $1.13 million.

title.children: Home ownership 'even more out of reach' for many with home prices surging in 2023

image.altText: Alice Springs township as seen from Anzac Hill.

props.synopsis: NT Police have launched an investigation after a 19-year-old man was found dead on Undoolya Road on Monday.

title.children: 19-year-old man found dead on remote road near Alice Springs in suspicious circumstances

image.altText: A film still of Michael Fassbender, crouching and screaming, surrounded by a Pacific Islander football team, in green.

props.synopsis: The much-loved Kiwi director returns with a movie based on the true story of the American Samoa soccer team, starring Michael Fassbender.

title.children: Taika Waititi was once a renegade. Does his new movie measure up?

image.altText: Donald Trump points his finger while partially poking his tongue out

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's eligibility to run in 2024 is in question, with courts all over the country weighing in – but so far the latest legal dramas are playing straight into the former president's hands, writes North America correspondent Barbara Miller.

title.children: As Trump's legal woes spiral, can anything keep him from a second tilt at the White House?

image.altText: A young man in military uniform takes a selfie in front of a tank.

props.synopsis: Captain Lior Sivan has become the first Australian to be killed while fighting for Israel against Hamas inside Gaza.

title.children: 32-year-old Australian man serving with Israeli army killed inside Gaza

image.altText: helicopter flies in front of plumes of smoke coming from Gaza strip

props.synopsis: An Israeli man who never served in the military has been charged with impersonating a soldier and stealing weapons after sneaking into an army unit and joining the fight against Hamas.

title.children: Israeli man indicted for impersonating a soldier as military says it will shift thousands of troops out of Gaza

image.altText: picture of Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu

props.synopsis: Israel's Supreme Court has struck down a highly disputed law passed by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's right-wing government that rolled back some of the high court's power and sparked months of nationwide protests.

title.children: Israel's Supreme Court strikes down disputed law that limited court oversight

image.altText: Three guinea pigs look at the camera, one is eating a mouthful of pumpkin.

props.synopsis: They "eat like you wouldn't believe" and don't burrow or climb, but after introducing nearly 140 of the critters to his property in Far North Queensland last year he has lost almost two-thirds to predators.

title.children: John found a solution for farm weeds, but keeping his guinea pig workers safe from predators is a challenge

image.altText: Leg spin bowler Lloyd Pope standing at the Adelaide Oval

props.synopsis: Lloyd Pope made his first-class debut for South Australia in the 2018-19 season and in his second match took 7-87 in an innings against Queensland, becoming the youngest bowler to take a seven wicket haul in the Sheffield Shield.

title.children: Forgotten leg spin bowler still dreams of playing for Australia
